there, so as to form a complete circle, and zones 14.14 & 15.15. are formed
with cyclical regularity, as would be any other zones subsequently
produced. The same general plan is seen to prevail in the
specimens of which the central portions are figured in Plate
XI, Figs 4.6.7; for in each it will be seen that only a small
number of the outer zones have grown cyclically and concentrically
all the interior zones being incomplete segments, which are
perceived to form smaller and smaller proportions of their
respective circles as we trace them inwards to the centre
from which they have proceeded.
